title: Hoytether™ Tension Member For Space Propulsion Applications, Prototype, "Hoytether™ Tension Member for Space Propulsion Applications", designed 2001, manufactured 2004
medium: Multi-line braid of Zylon®PBO with braided interconnections
dimensions: Overall: 500 x 20.3 cm (16 ft. 4 7/8 in. x 8 in.)
description: Length of interconnected braids in rust color.
justification: This braided space tether, which was designed in 2001 by Dr. Robert P. Hoyt and manufactured in 2004 by Tethers Unlimited, Inc., is made out of one of the strongest fibers available today, manufactured by Toyobo Co., Ltd. The textile acts as a momentum-exchange tether that takes advantage of the momentum of a body in orbit to âthrowâ a payload, such as a satellite, into a different orbit. Such an apparatus could be adapted for the low-fuel transportation of loads to the moon or perhaps even farther. Its rust colored, multi-line braid of ZylonÂ®PBO with braided interconnections is designed to provide redundancy and prevent all the strands from being severed or damaged. This textile has a high performance application, and demonstrates that strength can come from fine and flexible fibers.

type.name: Hoytether™ tension member for space propulsion applications, prototype
